column1: Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Rosie. Rosie loved to play in the forest and hop around all day. One day, she found a shiny ornament on the ground. column1: Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Isabella. Isabella lived in a jolly house with her mommy and daddy. One sunny day, Isabella and her family decided to go for a walk in the park. They saw many trees, flowers, and animals. Isabella loved to watch the birds fly and the squirrels run.As they walked, Isabella's mommy and daddy seemed to be looking for something. Isabella wondered what they were searching for. She asked, "What are we looking for, mommy?" Her mommy smiled and said, "We are looking for a screw, Isabella. We need it to fix something at home."Isabella's eyes widened with excitement. She wanted to help her mommy and daddy find the screw. She looked all around, under the benches and near the swings. But no matter how hard she looked, she couldn't find the screw. It seemed like it was hiding from her. Isabella felt a little sad, but she knew she had tried her best. column1: Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. Jack loved playing outside, but one day it started to rain really hard. So, Jack's mom told him, "Jack, you can't go outside today, but I have something cool for you to do inside!" Jack was very curious and asked, "What is it, Mom?" His mom smiled and said, "I'll let you watch a movie on the screen!" Jack's eyes got big with excitement. He loved watching movies! His mom turned on the TV and let Jack choose a movie. Jack sat on the couch and watched the screen. But something strange happened. Every time the movie started, Jack noticed a little bug crawling on the screen. It was so small that nobody else could see it. Jack tried to tell his mom, but she didn't understand what he was saying. She thought he was just pretending. Jack didn't give up. He let the movie play and watched carefully. Suddenly, the bug crawled inside the screen and disappeared! Jack was amazed. He realized that the bug had been living inside the screen all along. From that day on, Jack always checked the screen before watching a movie, just in case there was another bug hiding inside.;"{'noun': 'screen'

column1: Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Daisy. Daisy lived in a big, blue pond with her friends. One sunny day, Daisy decided to go on an adventure. She waddled out of the pond and walked towards a deep forest. Daisy loved exploring new places!  As she hopped along, Daisy noticed something strange. There were big, round things lying on the ground. "Potatoes!" she quacked happily. Daisy loved potatoes! She picked one up and put it in her little beak. But oh no! The potato was too big and didn't match her small beak. Daisy felt sad.  Just then, her friend Danny the dog came running towards her. "Woof! Woof!" he barked. Danny saw Daisy struggling and asked, "What's wrong, Daisy?" Daisy explained how she couldn't eat the potato because it was too big. Danny had an idea! He picked up a stick and dug a deep hole in the ground.  Danny dropped the potato into the hole and covered it up with soil. "Now," he said, "we just have to wait for the potato to grow small, so it can match your beak!" Daisy and Danny sat next to the hole, waiting and waiting. Days went by, and a little green sprout started to appear. Daisy and Danny were so excited!  Finally, the sprout turned into a small potato that perfectly matched Daisy's beak. She happily gobbled it up, and they both danced with joy. Daisy was grateful for her friend Danny, who helped her solve the big potato problem. From that day on, Daisy and Danny always stuck together, ready for more exciting adventures.;"{'noun': 'potato'
